newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary to launch 7-yr samurai bonds of 50 bln yen.
newsitem.headline: Hungary to launch 7-yr samurai bonds of 50 bln yen.

text.p: Hungary has commissioned Japan's Daiwa Securities to launch 50 billion yen ($411.9 million) worth of samurai bonds, the National Bank of Hungary said on Wednesday.
The seven-year bonds will bear an interest rate of 2.75 percent, the NBH said.
"The issue will enable the NBH to swap earlier debts of higher interest rates, in addition to meeting its 1997 interest and capital payment obligations," the central bank said in a statement.
This will result in substantial interest savings for the country, it said.
The present issue is the NBH's twenty-eighth samurai bond, the central bank said.
